statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

header.gameNote: CONTINENTAL TIRE LAS VEGAS INVITATIONAL - CAMPUS GAME

article.description: Marcus Zegarowski scored 19 points and Ty-Shon Alexander scored 18 and Creighton beat North Florida 76-67 on Sunday.
article.headline: Zegarowski, Alexander pace Creighton over N. Florida 76-67
article.linkText: Zegarowski, Alexander pace Creighton over N. Florida 76-67
article.story: OMAHA, Neb. -- Marcus Zegarowski scored 19 points and Ty-Shon Alexander added 18, and Creighton beat North Florida 76-67 on Sunday. Mitch Ballock added 15 points and 11 rebounds and Damien Jefferson scored 12 for the Bluejays (4-1), now winners of three straight. North Florida (4-3) built a 36-31 lead at intermission before Creighton started the second half with an 11-5 run and led for the remainder after Alexander's 3-pointer made it 42-41 with 16:48 left. Ballock's 3-pointer midway through the half extended the Bluejays' lead to 64-49. North Florida never got closer than seven points the rest of the way. Carter Hendricksen led the Ospreys with 19 points and Wajid Aminu scored 17. North Florida remained winless on the road and now has dropped two straight. --- For more AP college basketball coverage: https://apnews.com/Collegebasketball and http://twitter.com/AP-Top25
